description: The execvp patch caused a few things to stop working. Some were things that weren't ported to proper argv passing, others small artefacts. These are generally not caught by unit tests, because we (almost?) always stub out execute.
title: execvp fallout

comments.content: The execvp patch caused a few things to stop working. Some were things that weren't ported to proper argv passing, others small artefacts. These are generally not caught by unit tests, because we (almost?) always stub out execute.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content:
From duplicate bug:

_execute('sudo', 'ip', 'link', 'set', bridge, up)
NameError: global name 'up' is not defined
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Thanks, Thierry. I added a fix for that to the branch.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content: '%(VIF)s' without % replacement in vif_rules.py causing breakage of an ebtables command. Other aesthetic formatting issues in vif_rules.py exist as well.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ewindisch

comments.content: Splitting this in a separate bug. See bug 733137. The issues that Soren reported are fixed, this is (more) fallout. Reopening fixed issues causes havoc.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
